text:
Hi everyone, I hope you are doing well!
In the last months, I have been facing some issues with the incoming logs to n8n (self-hsoted).
So basically I monitored the outgoing logs from HubSpot and the incoming logs received from n8n workflow
We always received the half of logs (more less) sent by HubSpot

The actions we tried in order to solve:
• we implemented PUB-SUB in order to queue the incoming logs, but also here there was number discrepancy 
• We tried to route the HubSpot events to the cloud version, but also here there is a discrepancy, but from what I saw a bit less, but still there.
We are speaking about 10k events approximately each week, so not so many.

TO note:
We have other use cases where the events coming from Salesforce are ALL logged, even with self-hosted and pub-sub
Maybe here there is an issue with HubSpot side, wdyt?
One of my HubDB tables suddenly has 998 rows with the majority of these rows just empty rows. Is there a way to bulk delete these?
You’ll have to do it through <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb|the HubDB API>, unfortunately. To my knowledge, there isn’t a way to bulk edit records via the HubDB GUI.
Figma Dev Mode is now paid along with new features: <https://www.figma.com/blog/dev-mode-ga/>
